content: The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2004" requires proof of citizenship with voter registration applications. The National Voter Registration Act of 1993 is amended to require applicants to provide a photographic copy of a document proving U.S. citizenship with their motor vehicle license application. The National Voter Registration Act of 1993 is amended to require applicants to provide a photographic copy of a document proving U.S. citizenship. This requirement is in accordance with guidelines established by the Election Administration Commission in consultation with the Secretary of Homeland Security and the Secretary of State. The National Voter Registration Act of 1993 is amended to require proof of U.S. citizenship for individuals in states without registration requirements or permitting same-day registration. A photographic copy of a citizenship document is necessary to receive a ballot for federal elections. The National Voter Registration Act of 1993 is amended to require proof of U.S. citizenship for individuals in states without registration requirements or permitting same-day registration. A photographic copy of a citizenship document is necessary to register to vote in an election for Federal office. The National Voter Registration Act of 1993 is amended to require proof of U.S. citizenship for voter registration, with a consultation process involving the Election Administration Commission, Secretary of Homeland Security, and Secretary of State. A conforming amendment is made to the Act. SEC. 3. REQUIRING VOTERS TO PROVIDE PHOTO IDENTIFICATION. SEC. 3. REQUIRING VOTERS TO PROVIDE PHOTO IDENTIFICATION. Amends Section 303(b) of the Help America Vote Act to require individuals voting in person or by mail for Federal office to present a current and valid photo identification. The Help America Vote Act now requires individuals voting by mail for Federal office to include a copy of a current photo ID with their ballot. Amendments were made to Section 303 of the Act to reflect this change. The Help America Vote Act now requires individuals voting by mail for Federal office to include a copy of a current photo ID with their ballot. This requirement applies to the regularly scheduled general election for Federal office held in November 2004 and each succeeding election.
